monogr.title: A Digital Dictionary of Shawi Arabic

prefixDef.p: Private URIs using the teiCorpusHeader prefix are pointers to any element in the SHAWI teiCorpus document.
Private URIs using the share prefix are pointers to audio file residing on the SHAWI network share.
Private URIs using the geo prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a place element in VICAV Geodata list.
Private URIs using the zotid prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a biblStruct element in the TEI export of the VICAV Zotero Group library.
Private URIs using the dict prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a entry in the SHAWI glossary.

spanGrp.span: His holiness Ali, may God be pleased with him, was once in battle. He would remain in the war for months. They were in the war for ten, fifteen or even twenty days.
When they returned from war, he came to his house. When he arrived home, our mother Fatima, his wife, her holiness Fatima
She said to him, “O Ali!” Al-Hasan and al-Hussein, his sons, were six or seven years old.
She said to him, “Al-Hasan and al-Hussein are hungry. There is no food! There is no food for them to eat. They do not eating any food. They are hungry."
His holiness Ali looked and said, “O patient God! My God is the lord. O my Lord!” He had no money, no wealth.
He looked like this and put on his cloak, the chain armour which he used to wear in battle. We call it çelik zırh in Turkish.
It is a kind of armour made of iron. He wore it to prevent swords from piercing him when he was fighting.
He said, “O my Lord! O patient God! I will go to the market to sell this. I will sell it to buy food for my children al-Hasan and al-Hussein.”
What did they eat at those times? Bread and potatoes. Common food or meat. He wanted to sell this armour to bring food for them.
He went to the market. He searched and searched and sold it for 500 dirhams. In the past, there was the dirham, they used to call it dirham.
When he sold it for 500 dirhams, he took the money, the dirhams, and went to the market to buy vegetables for his children. Let’s say vegetables, like today.
Before he reached the market or while he was already at the market, there were two men arguing. The two of them were fighting.
He went to them and asked, “Why are you fighting?" One of them replied; they did not know his holiness, Ali.
He said, “O brother, I am demanding from this man the 500 dirhams he owes me and he refuses to give them to me.”
His holiness Ali said, “O patient God!” and replied to the other man, “O brother, does this man demand 500 dirhams from you?”

He said, “Yes, he is demanding this from me, my friend.” So he asked, “Why don’t you give it to him?” The man replied, “I don’t have it, and now he says, ‘Either you give it to me or I will kill you!’”
He said, “No man! Don’t kill him! For the sake of God! Take it, my brother!” He reached into his pocket and took out the 500 dirhams. “Here you go, brother, these are your 500 dirhams.
For the sake of God, I will remove the harm which is between you so that you do not fight.” He gave the 500 dirhams to him and left.
His holiness Ali returned home. The dirhams were gone. He did not bring anything for his children. And once again, al-Hussein
At home, they were crying from hunger, wanting food.
Her holiness Fatima said to him, “O Ali, why didn’t you bring any food?” He replied, “O Fatima! This is what happened. I went to the market
And I sold my armour for 500 dirhams. When I came to the (vegetable) market to I was on my way to the market when I saw two men fighting.
I resolved their dispute for the sake of God as one of them was demanding 500 dirhams from the other.
I paid the debt on behalf of the other man and resolved their dispute for the sake of God. This is better than feeding al-Hasan and al-Hussein.”
His children were crying from hunger, “Wah wah wah.” They were hungry! What does a hungry child do? He cries!
And he shouted, “O mother! I am hungry, I want bread, I want water, I want food.” There was no food at home.
Her holiness Fatima came to him again and said, “O Ali, go to the market! Maybe you will find a friend; maybe you will know someone and bring food for them. They are perishing from hunger.”
His holiness Ali left and went to the cattle market; (the market) for the female and the male camel.
When he reached the cattle market, he saw a man grasping a she-camel with his hand and driving it toward the cattle market.
His holiness Ali encountered him. His holiness Ali said to him, “Where are you going, my friend?”
He said, “Actually I want to take this she-camel to the cattle market. I want to sell this animal at the cattle market.
And where are you going?” He replied, “I also want to go there. Actually, I thought maybe, since I’m looking for the market, I would go to the cattle market.”

The man asked, “What are you looking for?” He replied, “Actually, I’m looking for a friend. Perhaps I might find one who has something with him that I can buy and sell. I want to bring food for my children and such.”
“Yes,” the man said, “I will give you this camel.” He replied, “But I don't have any money.”
The man said, “I will give it to you on credit. I will sell it to you on credit. When you have the money, you can give me back its value.”
His holiness Ali said, “Do you know me? How can you give me the camel? Perhaps I won’t give you the money back.”

The man said, “I know your face, I will never forget your appearance! I will give it to you and when you have money one day, I will be at a certain place. A certain person at that place will bring me the money.”
He asked, “How much is it, brother?” The man replied, “I will give it to you on credit for 500 dirhams.”

His holiness Ali took it for 500 dirhams and grabbed the camel by its headcollar.” You know what the headcollar is, right? — Yes. He then started driving it, intending to take it to the cattle market to sell it.
Before he reached the cattle market, he encountered another person, different from the previous one.
“Hey, where are you going, brother? Are you coming or going?” He replied, “Actually, I want to take this she-camel to the cattle market to sell it.”
He said, “I need a she-camel. Won’t you sell it to me?” He replied, “I will sell it to you.”
He asked, “How much do you want for it?" He replied, “Actually, I just took it from someone for 500 dirhams on credit.
But I want to sell it for cash now; I need the money immediately. For how much do you want it? Tell me, for how much will you buy it?”
He said, “I will also take it from you for 500 dirhams. I will give you the money in cash right now.”
He said, “O brother, I took it on credit for 500 and now you want to buy it from me for 500 in cash. Isn’t that too much? I will sell it to you for 400 or 300.”
He said, “O brother, isn’t it my money? I am taking it for 500. What is your concern? Take these 500 of yours and give me the she-camel.”
He said, “O patient God! Since you want it, here you go!” That man gave the 500 dirhams to his holiness Ali, took the she-camel from him and left.
His holiness Ali went to the market and bought potatoes for the 500 dirhams. Or, let’s say, he bought anything what was available at that season (of the year).
He bought meat, bread, potatoes, grapes, and whatever was available in that season. I don’t know exactly what.
He had spent all 500 dirhams and bought food for them when he returned with the food to her holiness Fatima.
He gave the food to Fatima and she asked him, “How? Where did you get this from? Where did you go?”
He said, “Actually, O Fatima, this is what happened. I met someone who sold me the she-camel. And someone else bought it from me for 500 dirhams. So, I brought food for al-Hasan and al-Hussein.”
She said to him, “Alright, God is generous.” He sat like this, placed his hand on his face and began to think. His holiness Ali placed his hand on his face.
The house of the Prophet, the messenger of God, was nearby. The Prophet was their neighbour.
The Prophet, peace be upon him, sent his companions to call for his holiness Ali, saying, “Go and call for Ali to come to me!”
His holiness Ali came to him. The Prophet, peace be upon him, received revelation and so he knew everything. The Lord of the worlds, in His glory and majesty, informed him.
When he came (the Prophet) said, “O Ali, why are you lost in thought? I heard that you are deep in thought and worried about the family. So, I called for you.”
He said, “O messenger of God, this is how things are.” He asked, “O Ali, do you know why you are worried?” He replied, “What is it?”
(The Prophet) said, “When you went to the market and saw the two men who were quarrelling: one of them was Gabriel, and the other was Michael.
The Lord of the worlds had sent them. One was Gabriel and the other was Michael. That quarrel was not real.
And you, for the sake of the Lord of the worlds, when you gave the money, your money, to please Him, would He forget you? He will never forget you!

And the one who sold the she-camel to you was Israfil. So, this times another angel. Michael was also one of them. The one who sold it to you was Israfil, and the one who bought it from you was Michael.
The lesson of this story is that the Lord of the worlds, in His glory and majesty, placed you in a test.
To see what you would do: And you did everything to please Him. He does not forget the one who does not forget Him. Enjoy it!
